author: Francisco-Gamino
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------
```
# Create a pssession pointing to localhost
PS C:\> Enter-PSSession .
 
# Execute Invoke-RestMethod 
[localhost]: PS C:\> Invoke-RestMethod https://iisnanoadmin:55538/api/webserver/sites -UseDefaultCredentials
 
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
```
The  Invoke-RestMethod operation should success, but it does not.

# To work around this issue, we create a credentials object first, 
# which should be the same behavior as using '-UseDefaultCredentials'

[localhost]: PS C:\> $cred = Get-Credential
Windows PowerShell Credential Request: cmdlet Get-Credential at command pipeline position 1
Warning: A script or application on the remote computer LOCALHOST is requesting your credentials. 
Enter your credentials only if you trust the remote computer and the application or script that is requesting them.
Supply values for the following parameters:
Credential
# Execute Invoke-RestMethod 
[localhost]: PS C:\> Invoke-RestMethod https://iisnanoadmin:55538/api/webserver/sites -Credential
 $cred  | ConvertTo-Json
{
    "sites":  [
                  {
                      "name":  "Default Web Site",
                      "id":  "7RbD5AMHAfQt2lU1c5jV_g",
                      "_links":  "@{self=}"
                  },
                  {
                      "name":  "Asp.Net5 Web Site",
                      "id":  "mBUe2zWqfUnJKxkjZQNnqA",
                      "_links":  "@{self=}"
                  }
              ]
}
```
Actual behavior
---------------
```
The remote server returned an error: (401) Unauthorized.
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (System.Net.HttpWebRequest:HttpWebRequest) [Invoke-RestMethod], WebExc
   eption
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : WebCmdletWebResponseException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.InvokeRestMethodCommand
```
Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable

```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @Francisco-Gamino isn't this a double hop issue?  if you use credssp to create the initial pssession, I expect this to work

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: @Francisco-Gamino I believe @SteveL-MSFT  is right and what you are experiencing is the double-hop issue. I'm going to close this issue but if you can provide a repro for this that demonstrates it is not related to double-hop we can re-open.

title: -UseDefaultCredentials for the Web Cmdlets do not work when the cmdlet is executed inside a pssession
